newsitem.title: FINLAND: Outokumpu sets new Pampalo gold find study.
newsitem.headline: Outokumpu sets new Pampalo gold find study.

text.p: Finnish mining and metals group Outokumpu Oy said in a statement on Monday it would make further studies of the Pampalo gold find in Ilomantsi in northern Finland.
Preliminary studies of surface layers in the area had yielded promising results, Outokumpu said. The current deposit of some 0.6 million tonnes had a gold content of 7.3 grams per tonne.
Outokumpu would now dig tunnels to a depth of 100 metres. The deposit was known to extend to at least 280 metres below ground level.
Based on the outcome of the new studies, Outokumpu would decide on further action in spring 1998, it said.
